message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with depth estimation from light field images using a convolutional neural network. Additionally, the paper also discusses data augmentation techniques specific to light field images, which is a common topic in computer vision research.

The paper also involves graphics (cs.GR) as it deals with 3D modelling and refocusing, which are common topics in computer graphics.

The use of a neural network for depth estimation also suggests that the paper may belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.

The paper's focus on accuracy and speed in depth estimation suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.

Finally, the paper's use of light field cameras and its focus on depth estimation suggests that it may also belong to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category, as light field cameras are commonly used in robotics applications.
